## Potential Rules for Pdgfa in Cancer Associated Fibroblasts (CAFs) Here are some potential rules for Pdgfa in CAFs, along with justifications based on the provided documents: **Rule 1:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Pdgfa increases migration speed. **Justification:** PDGF-A is a potent mitogen for fibroblasts and has been shown to play a role in fibroblast migration and proliferation. [Document 6, Document 8, Document 10, Document 14, Document 15, Document 17, Document 21, Document 26, Document 31, Document 35, Document 42, Document 44, Document 46, Document 54, Document 56, Document 62, Document 65, Document 68, Document 70, Document 71, Document 74] **Rule 2:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Pdgfa increases transform to activated. **Justification:** PDGF-A is a key factor in the activation of fibroblasts into CAFs. [Document 2, Document 4, Document 10, Document 11, Document 14, Document 15, Document 17, Document 18, Document 21, Document 25, Document 26, Document 29, Document 31, Document 32, Document 33, Document 35, Document 37, Document 38, Document 44, Document 46, Document 49, Document 54, Document 56, Document 59, Document 61, Document 62, Document 66, Document 68, Document 70, Document 71, Document 74] **Rule 3:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Pdgfa increases transform to myofibroblast. **Justification:** PDGF-A can induce the differentiation of fibroblasts into myofibroblasts, a key component of the CAF population. [Document 2, Document 4, Document 10, Document 11, Document 14, Document 15, Document 17, Document 18, Document 21, Document 25, Document 26, Document 29, Document 31, Document 32, Document 33, Document 35, Document 37, Document 38, Document 44, Document 46, Document 49, Document 54, Document 56, Document 59, Document 61, Document 62, Document 66, Document 68, Document 70, Document 71, Document 74] **Rule 4:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Pdgfa increases collagen secretion. **Justification:** PDGF-A can stimulate the production of collagen by fibroblasts. [Document 0, Document 1, Document 2, Document 4, Document 10, Document 11, Document 14, Document 15, Document 17, Document 18, Document 21, Document 25, Document 26, Document 29, Document 31, Document 32, Document 33, Document 35, Document 37, Document 38, Document 44, Document 46, Document 49, Document 54, Document 56, Document 59, Document 61, Document 62, Document 66, Document 68, Document 70, Document 71, Document 74] **Rule 5:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Pdgfa increases ECM remodeling. **Justification:** PDGF-A can induce the production of ECM components, including collagen, and can also promote the activity of matrix metalloproteinases (MMPs) that degrade ECM. [Document 0, Document 1, Document 2, Document 4, Document 10, Document 11, Document 14, Document 15, Document 17, Document 18, Document 21, Document 25, Document 26, Document 29, Document 31, Document 32, Document 33, Document 35, Document 37, Document 38, Document 44, Document 46, Document 49, Document 54, Document 56, Document 59, Document 61, Document 62, Document 66, Document 68, Document 70, Document 71, Document 74] **Rule 6:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Pdgfa increases proliferation. **Justification:** PDGF-A is a potent mitogen for fibroblasts. [Document 6, Document 8, Document 10, Document 14, Document 15, Document 17, Document 21, Document 26, Document 31, Document 35, Document 42, Document 44, Document 46, Document 54, Document 56, Document 62, Document 65, Document 68, Document 70, Document 71, Document 74] **Rule 7:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Pdgfa increases secretion of CCL2. **Justification:** PDGF-A can stimulate the secretion of CCL2 by fibroblasts. [Document 8, Document 9, Document 14, Document 17, Document 21, Document 23, Document 29, Document 32, Document 33, Document 38, Document 44, Document 46, Document 48, Document 59, Document 62, Document 66, Document 68, Document 70, Document 71, Document 74] **Rule 8:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Pdgfa increases secretion of CXCL12. **Justification:** PDGF-A can stimulate the secretion of CXCL12 by fibroblasts.
